text: how do you guys integrate intercom on ember apps?
or just loading the script tag in a model hook

not sure if anyone else is riding 2.7 and/or above

but it looks like changes to the build process seem to have affected peeps using ember-cli-deploy <@U043AB2QT> 

as the article suggests <http://emberjs.com/blog/2016/04/28/baseURL.html>

However my img tags with absolute or relative paths dont reference the asset host properly :disappointed: see <https://github.com/ember-cli/ember-cli/issues/6199>

attachments.fallback: GitHub: Not sure if 2.7.1 breaks ember-cli-deploy · Issue #6199 · ember-cli/ember-cli

text: <@U047GTU64>: How had this broken for you in terms of ember-cli-deploy? The build plugin just uses ember-cli's builder class. Not clear how the baseUrl affects that. Got any more info?
<@U043AB2QT> I thought you guys made use of the old `baseURL` somewhere which might be causing some issues
but now that I think about it, must be something of ember-cli and nothing to do with ember-cli-deploy?
since my problem is that assetHost is not being prepended whenever I reference something on a tag, right?
let me update that issue title though :smile:
Nothing to do with ember-cli-deploy I'd say.
issue titled changed then :slightly_smiling_face: - thank you
I think you'll find its nothing to do with ember-cli-deploy. I suspect if you do an ember build you'll find the same thing. It's worth confirming that.
